Our latest fact-checks

Not the naked truth

Donald Trump

Says Ted Cruz distributed the ad showing a nude Melania Trump on a rug.  

A consistent story

Donald Trump

Says that when Michelle Fields "found out that there was a security camera, and that they had her on tape, all of a sudden that story changed."

Not entirely clear what he's trying to say

Donald Trump

"There’s a tremendous tax that we pay when we (American businesses) go into China, whereas when China sells to us there’s no tax."

All pain, little gain

Hillary Clinton

When it comes to fighting terrorism, "Another thing we know that does not work, based on lots of empirical evidence, is torture."

Different policies

Hillary Clinton

"It’s actually easier for the United States to get flight manifests from E.U. nations than it is for E.U. nations to get them from their own neighbors, thanks to an agreement the U.S. negotiated when I was secretary of state."

Bernie takes the crown

Bernie Sanders

"Bernie Sanders passed more roll call amendments in a Republican Congress than any other member."

Remnants of the Cold War

Paul Ryan

"To this day, (the Cuban government) is a regime that provides safe harbor to terrorists and fugitives."

People who have read the deal say otherwise

Donald Trump

"When those restrictions expire (in the Iran nuclear deal), Iran will have an industrial-size military nuclear capability ready to go."

U.S. was careful not to guarantee anything

Ted Cruz

"Ukraine voluntarily gave up its nuclear weapons because the United States of America" said it would "ensure (its) territorial integrity from Russia."  

Confuses "attacks" with "activity"

Donald Trump

"During the last five years, Iran has perpetrated terror attacks in 25 different countries on five continents."

Single-use tradition

Mitch McConnell

Says Senate Republicans are "following a longstanding tradition of not filling vacancies on the Supreme Court in the middle of a presidential election year."  

The data backs him up

Joe Pitts

"According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), about 120 Americans on average die from a drug overdose every day. Overall, drug overdose deaths now outnumber deaths from firearms."

60 Minutes interview out of context

Club for Growth

Says Donald Trump promised "to take care of everybody (through government-run healthcare and) the government's going to pay for it."

Not quite the same thing

Harry Reid

Senate Democrats "have never held up a Supreme Court nomination."

Media can't get enough of Trump

John Kasich

Says Donald "Trump got, you know, $1.8 billion worth of free media. I got, like, none."

Widely shared Democratic graphic is accurate

Mike Honda

"Six justices" on the U.S. Supreme Court have been "confirmed in presidential election years since 1912."  

Expert: He got the name of country right, but that's it

Donald Trump

Under the Iran nuclear deal, "we give them $150 billion, we get nothing."

Trend long predates Obama

Ted Cruz

Says President Barack Obama has "been presiding over our jobs going overseas for seven years."

The CDC data adds up

Hillary Clinton

"Gun violence is by far the leading cause of death for young African American men, outstripping the next nine causes of death combined."

Old data quoted incorrectly, but trend is right

Everytown for Gun Safety

The rate of U.S. female homicide victims outnumbers 24 other developed countries by more than 2½ to 1.

How to contact us

Email comments and suggestions for fact-checks to truthometer@politifact.com or find us on Facebook, Twitter and Google+. (If you send us a comment, we'll assume you don't mind us publishing it unless you tell us otherwise.)

We're especially interested in any viral images or social media memes that you would like us to check out.
